question: Which union minister has inaugurated India's largest waste-to-power plant in New Delhi?
explanation: The Union Urban Development Minister Venkaiah Naidu has recently inaugurated Indiaâ€™s largest waste-to-power plant at Narela-Bawana in New Delhi. The 24 Mega Watt plant would not only dispose of 1,300 Metric Tonne waste on a daily basis but also produce compost and energy. The project, built at a cost of Rs. 650 crore and spread across around 100 acres at Narela-Bawana, will use 2,000 metric tonnes of solid waste every day to generate 24 MW of energy. The power generated would be sold to distribution companies for a price fixed by electricity regulator.
